data.title: How do you calculate DeltaG for a reaction from DeltaH and DeltaS values?
data.meta_description: Delta"G"=Delta"H"^@-"T"Delta"S" In order to calculate the free energy for a reaction, the above equation should be used. Thus, the temperature of the experiment, in Kelvin, must be known. Also, Delta"S" is given in "J" "K"^-1 "mol"^-1, thus it must be converted into "kJ" "K"^-1 "mol"^-1, otherwise the Delta"G" value will be incorrect.
data.text:
In order to calculate the free energy for a reaction, the above equation should be used. Thus, the temperature of the experiment, in Kelvin, must be known.

Also, #Delta"S"# is given in #"J"# #"K"^-1# #"mol"^-1#, thus it must be converted into #"kJ"# #"K"^-1# #"mol"^-1#, otherwise the #Delta"G"# value will be incorrect.
